intro: Pelargonium veronicifolium, commonly known as the veronicifolium geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its succulent, lobed leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Pelargonium veronicifolium is also valued for its resilience to drought and salt spray, making it suitable for coastal gardens.
